page.title: 06Draining Horse-Eye Marshland
page.content: The ecology of the Horse-Eye Levels has been greatly altered in the latter part of the 20th century. The Levels are privately owned Freehold and worked by owner farmers or tenant farmers. Drainage is the responsibility of Southern Water Authority who are paid from Water Rates & by resident farmers who pay extra for any more local & immediate advantage obtained. Previous high water level restricted use of the land to grassland. Controlled drainage via use of a pumping station & the dykes has reduced the water level, so that some areas can be ploughed and used for crops.
